text: Abraham "Abe" Lincoln Biglow (April 27, 1872 – March 15, 1923) was an American politician and businessman. Born in Farmer, Ohio, Biglow went to school in Ada, Ohio and Washington, Pennsylvania. He then taught school. In 1893, he worked for the Williams County Telephone Company. Then in 1910, Biglow moved to Ashland, Wisconsin and worked for the telephone company as general manager. He then worked for the chemical and mining businesses. He served on the Ashland County, Wisconsin Board of Supervisors in 1914. In 1921, Biglow served in the Wisconsin State Assembly and was a Republican. Biglow died in Mark Center, Ohio while visiting friends.Wisconsin Blue Book 1921, Biographical Sketch of Abe L. Biglow, p. 260.A.L. Biglow-obituary, Bryan Democrat (Williams County, Ohio), March 23, 1921, p. 7. ==Notes== Category:1872 births Category:1923 deaths Category:People from Defiance County, Ohio Category:People from Ashland, Wisconsin Category:Educators from Ohio Category:Businesspeople from Ohio Category:Businesspeople from Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin Republicans Category:County supervisors in Wisconsin Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly
title: Abe L. Biglow
